Description: Fragment of red glass bowl: from the rim and upper body of a monochrome, opaque red-glass bowl, the surface now turning golden brown. Moulded. Flat projecting rim. The upper body has a convex profile and the lower body probably was of the same form. Extensive traces of wheel turning.
Curator's comments: The type is almost certainly of Alexandrian origin. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie 'et al.', 'Tanis' I (1885), 46, 'saucers of opaque red glass, ground and polished'. Numerous examples of these monochrome bowls appeared in the royal Kushite burials excavated by the Harvard University-Boston Museum of Fine Arts Expedition. Their date range was mid-third century B.C. to about the middle of the first century A.D.; Favard-Meeks in Brissaud and C.Zivie-Coche 'Tanis: 1987-1997' (1998) p.130.
